result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer M Sharpley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the $150.00 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer M Sharpley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jennifer M Sharpley
Current: 429 Pine River St, Redgranite, WI 54970 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2015)
Prior: 203 Broadway St Apt A, Berlin, WI 54923
Judgment of conviction has been returned.  Return to sender.  Re-sent to:  429 Pine River Street  Redgranite, WI  54970

9:47 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine and costs.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Court will grant expungement if all conditions are completed.
Defendant to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the $150 bond be applied to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 9:52 a.m.

9:44 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement byStatement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney and requests to talk with the DA.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court sets for Status Hearing on July 21, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:46 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

1:57 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $150.00 cash bond and condition of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 7, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:59 p.m.
